title: 107_s1134
content: The Act may be cited as the "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001" and includes modifications applicable to qualified small business stock. Repeal of Minimum Tax Preference and Increase in Rollover Period for Qualified Small Business Stock are amendments made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 under the "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001". The amendments involve removing a tax preference item and extending the rollover period from 60 days to 180 days for qualified small business stock. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 was amended to reduce the holding period for partial exclusion of gains from small business stock from 5 years to 3 years. Additionally, the per-issuer limitation on taxpayer's eligible gain was repealed. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 was amended to reduce the holding period for partial exclusion of gains from small business stock from 5 years to 3 years. The per-issuer limitation on taxpayer's eligible gain was repealed. Modifications include extending the qualified trade or business definition and repealing the working capital limitation. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 was amended to reduce the holding period for partial exclusion of gains from small business stock from 5 years to 3 years. The per-issuer limitation on taxpayer's eligible gain was repealed. Additionally, a waiver provision was added for stock purchases by the issuing corporation if a business purpose is established. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 was amended to increase the exclusion for gain from certain small business stock from 50 percent to 100 percent. Conforming amendments were made to related sections of the Code. Amendments were made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to increase the exclusion for gain from certain small business stock to 100 percent. This included redesignating paragraphs and amending the heading for section 1202. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 increased the exclusion for gains from certain small business stock to 100 percent. Section 1202 was amended to remove the partial exclusion for corporations. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 increased the exclusion for gains from certain small business stock to 100 percent. Subsection (c) of section 1202 was amended to specify that stock held among members of a controlled group is not eligible as qualified small business stock. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 was amended to increase the exclusion for gains from small business stock to $300,000,000. An inflation adjustment was also added for stock issued after 2002. The amendments made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 increased the exclusion for gains from small business stock to $300,000,000 and added an inflation adjustment for stock issued after 2002. The amendments also include adjustments for taxable years and effective dates for stock issued after the enactment of the Act.
